New Records: Brayan Bello delivered the longest outing of his career, pitching eight innings of two-hit ball on Wednesday night to lead the Boston Red Sox to a 3-0 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays.
Triston O'Neill homered to left center (405 feet), Hamilton scored.
Key Match Events: The game was scoreless until the 8th inning when Triston O'Neill hit a home run to left center (405 feet), giving the Red Sox their first runs of the game.
The game remained scoreless through eight innings, making it a low-scoring contest.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Fenway Park in Boston, Massachusetts, with an attendance of 32,809.
The game time was 2:05 PM, and the umpires were Brennan Miller, Chris Conroy, Shane Livensparger, and Brian O'Nora.
